item.title: By: Amos Batto
item.dc:creator: Amos Batto
item.description:
A great how-to. I struggled to set up a Pootle Server in Etch a couple weeks ago. I wish this how-to had been available at the time. It would have saved me hours of frustration.
I have two suggestions: Use "sudo -i" to login in as the user with administrative privileges rather than having to type "sudo" before every command.
You left out the "ln" command to create soft links.
Change: sudo /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/Pootle/pootle.prefs -s /etc/pootle/pootle.conf
To: sudo ln /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/Pootle/pootle.prefs -s /etc/pootle/pootle.conf
item.content:encoded:
A great how-to. I struggled to set up a Pootle Server in Etch a couple weeks ago. I wish this how-to had been available at the time. It would have saved me hours of frustration.

I have two suggestions:
Use “sudo -i” to login in as the user with administrative privileges rather than having to type “sudo” before every command.

You left out the “ln” command to create soft links.

Change:
sudo /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/Pootle/pootle.prefs -s /etc/pootle/pootle.conf

To:
sudo ln /usr/lib/python2.4/site-packages/Pootle/pootle.prefs -s /etc/pootle/pootle.conf
